summary: This is an email chain from November 2021 regarding the release of CBP (Customs and Border Protection) border crossing records for three named individuals for use in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The documents are password-protected and subject to a protective order. A CBP witness, Chief CBPO Best, is identified as available to testify.

persons.name: Everdell
persons.role: Attorney making request for CBP documents
persons.context: Addressed in the forwarded message as the recipient of the CBP documents; initially requested information via subpoena on October 14, 2021, and had a follow-up conversation on November 22, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The criminal proceedings are captioned United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; the CBP documents are for use in her ongoing criminal case.

persons.name: Chief CBPO Best
persons.context: Identified as the CBP witness available to provide testimony; works in the Office of the Associate Chief Counsel, New York U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

connections.description: Everdell is an attorney requesting CBP documents for use in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Chief CBPO Best is identified as a CBP witness available to testify in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Initial subpoena for CBP records
events.description: Attorney Everdell initially requested CBP border crossing records for three named individuals via subpoena.

events.title: Follow-up conversation on CBP request
events.description: A follow-up conversation occurred where the scope of the requested CBP documents was altered and it was confirmed they would be subject to the existing protective order.

events.title: CBP documents released
events.description: CBP released password-protected border crossing records for three individuals for use in the Maxwell case, with conditions on their use.

locations: One World Trade Center, 50th Floor, New York, NY
keyFacts: CBP released border crossing records for three named individuals for use in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
The documents are password-protected and subject to a strict protective order, with warnings about unauthorized disclosure.
The request for documents was initially made via subpoena on October 14, 2021, and modified in a follow-up conversation on November 22, 2021.
Chief CBPO Best is identified as the CBP witness available to testify regarding these records.
The records have been redacted to exclude sensitive law enforcement information and personally identifiable information of CBP officers.
